author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: Blake Lively Learning to Love Her "Mom Body" ‚Äì Blake Lively Opens Up About Her Postpartum Body
text:
Celebs don't typically talk about their postpartum body struggles ‚Äì it's not a particularly ~glam~ topic. But Blake Lively is getting real about the process of coming to accept her body's changes after giving birth to her second child with husband Ryan Reynolds .
During Monday night's L'Oreal Paris "Galentine's Day" event, the actress ‚Äì who attended with her older sister Robyn ‚Äì spoke with E! News about how pregnancy has impacted both her body and her self-image, along with how she's getting back into shape.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below "It's all a process. You know, after the second kid , it's really different. So this is not my normal body, but I like it," the mom of two said. "I'm learning to love my body in every iteration, and I think that's hard for women, and so I learned a lot."

A post shared by Blake Lively (@blakelively) on Feb 13, 2017 at 1:12pm PST
Lively, who's been open in the past about her breastfeeding woes , gave birth to her daughter Ines four months ago and has been working hard to get back into shape ever since. "You see your body after having a kid, and it's beautiful because you just gave birth but you also say, 'oh my god, this is not what my body looked like,'" she told Kylie and Jackie O , an Australian radio show, after giving birth last year. "You feel like you're never going to get your body back again. But you can! But that was what was encouraging about it!"
From an outside perspective, the actress' efforts are clearly working ‚Äì Lively looks amazing and super fit. But, as any woman knows, your relationship with your own body is a deeply personal and sensitive topic. No amount of "Oh my god, shut up, you look great!" can make you feel good when you're uncomfortable in your own skin. That's why Lively's description of "learning" to love her new body is apt and so important.
From: Redbook
